ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Ossicular Discontinuity
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: History of head trauma, unilateral conductive hearing loss, hypercompliant (Type Ad) tympanogram, and absent acoustic reflexes are consistent with ossicular chain disruption.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To determine the degree, type, and configuration of hearing loss.
To assess speech reception thresholds and word recognition abilities.
To evaluate tympanic membrane mobility and middle ear status.
To assess the integrity of the reflex arc and support differential diagnosis of conductive pathology.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The evaluation reveals normal hearing in the right ear and a conductive hearing loss in the left ear, ranging from slight to moderately severe. Immittance testing demonstrates a hypercompliant tympanogram (Type Ad) on the left side with absent acoustic reflexes, findings which are strongly indicative of ossicular discontinuity secondary to the reported trauma.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: Normal hearing (0-10 dB HL). Left ear: Conductive hearing loss, slight at low frequencies sloping to moderately severe at 8000 Hz, with significant air-bone gaps. Bone conduction normal bilaterally.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: SRT (RT 5 dB, LT 25 dB) consistent with PTA. WRS excellent bilaterally (96%).

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: Normal Type A (0.5 mL). Left ear: Hypercompliant Type Ad (2.9 mL), suggesting ossicular discontinuity.

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Right ipsilateral present; Right contralateral elevated. Left ipsilateral and contralateral absent.

proposed_items: Surgical intervention (ossicular chain reconstruction) to attempt hearing restoration
Amplification (hearing aid) for the left ear if surgery is not pursued or unsuccessful
counseling_actions: Explained the conductive nature of the hearing loss and the likelihood of ossicular discontinuity due to trauma
Discussed the pros and cons of surgical repair versus hearing aid amplification
Advised patient to consider options and follow up with decision

escalation.rationale_short: Referral for medical evaluation of ossicular discontinuity and discussion of surgical options.

follow_up_plan.timeline: Patient to schedule follow-up upon decision
follow_up_plan.objective: To proceed with either surgical referral or hearing aid fitting based on patient preference.
